title: Explain to me how this was toxic enough to cause a permanent ban.
body:
Okay, before I get to the chat log that it shows for why I got permanently banned lets get into what happened before this. I'm toxic. I'll straight up admit that. Had my account on a 2 week ban for being verbally abusive and I got it back at 5:30 AM on 5/11. Since this was my new main account (after having my first main account permanently banned) I decided "Okay just gonna drag my chat off screen so I can't see it and wont talk and therefore cant be toxic.". 4 hours later without getting in any trouble because I didnt talk in chat I que into a game with my friend. In this pre game lobby we encounter a player who instantly asks "can i trade you mid for jg?" I tell him no and hover trundle. Can you all guess what champion the guy decides to ban??? Trundle. We then ask him "wtf why would you ban my champ" he responds with just "lol". My friend was top lane and had lucian hovered. Troll was above him in pick order. Guess what champ the troll picks???? Lucian. so me and my friend go evelynn and shaco, I take smite, friend takes smite, ahri takes smite hoping this kid will dodge. he doesnt. We get into a game and we are legit trying to win, lucian takes top lane instead of mid, caitlyn goes bot lane solo, ahri goes mid instead of support and me and evelynn jungle and invade like an ordinary game. At this point my chat is still off my screen and out of view. I can still however hear the little "ping" whenever someone types and it is going off like crazy. Decide to see whats going on. Long story short lucian is crying that we have 3 smites and 2 legit junglers and questions why I picked shaco with trundle runes and masteries, and this is where my chat log begins. 4th message in and continuation is all in all chat talking to the enemy team asking who is the troll on our team. Only reason i picked up any reports is because the enemy vlad decided "im just gonna report all of you and let the tribunal (which doesnt even exist anymore) decide. end of the situation is our whole team picks up 4-5 reports from the enemy team, and im assuming lucian reported me and my duo as well as caitlyn. as you can see i tried to keep a positive attitude and win the game and not flame lucian or be toxic to anyone on my team but because i had just been 2 week banned not even 5 hours previous to this encounter I think the system automatically banned me just for picking up those reports. If only chat logs showed everyone's not just my chat.

**I'd like to see your reform card for that.** The system does not punished based on report volume, but on finding toxic behavior in a high percent/number of games. The Instant Feedback System, however, handles cases within 15 minutes of the triggering report, and has a false positive rate of 1:6000. Cases that fall within that infinitesimal margin can request a manual review to get it overturned. The new Tribunal will improve upon this even further.

Don't see why Riot as a company feels the need to PERMANENTLY ban players over vulgar language in-game. You created a MUTE system, so at least use it instead of jumping straight to permanent bans after so and so offenses. Stop banning in general for vulgar language. Use bans for players that are intentionally feeding, hacking the client, ddosing, etc. Actually things that are an unpleasant experience for other players to experience that cannot be stopped. You can stop a toxic player from affecting you by muting them. All you have to do as a company now is make it possible to mute their pings if needed. 

Yeah, I'm attacking how this company handles it's player punishments because there is a better way to deal with them and still allow them to play the game.

Hopefully someone comes along and straightens out this mess that was created.

Here we go with the whole "use the mute button if you don't want to listen to me harass you" excuse. From the [Tribunal FAQ](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2411284): 

>**What's the point of having a language filter if I can get banned for 'adult' language?**
We aren't out to punish players who use adult language; in fact, very few players are ever banned for saying stuff like "f***, I missed that skill shot" or "damn, f***ing close game!" However, the language filter is not an excuse to verbally abuse someone in the game. When you verbally abuse or harass someone by calling them "f***ing ******" or "n*gger noob", that's when you've crossed the line and will be punished by the Tribunal. I've said this before and I'll say it again, we aren't trying to clean online games of adult language; we're trying to reform or get rid of jerks who like to verbally abuse and harass other players.


>**Why is verbal abuse punishable if there is a mute button/language filter?**
Players shouldn’t need to rely on features like the mute button or language filter to engage with other players in positive ways. When a player verbally abuses another player and forces him to use the mute button, they have already created a negative experience for that player.

Simply put the mute button does not exist so you can say whatever you want with no consequences. If you can't interact with others without forcing them to use the mute button on you then the problem is you, not them.

As far as the other issues you brought up people who do those things are punished and banned, but the reason there aren't as many people complaining about getting banned for those things is because verbal toxicity is easier to detect than intentional feeding and the like. This DOESN'T mean that the other stuff isn't tracked, because it is, but verbal abuse is far more common and easily tracked than things like intentional feeding is.
> Yeah, I'm attacking how this company handles it's player punishments because there is a better way to deal with them and still allow them to play the game.

If you mean permamute then that won't work for everyone. The more dedicated trolls will just troll and be a jerk via gameplay if they can't use the chat to troll and be a jerk. Besides, allowing someone to continue playing after they have proven time and again that they have no interest in behaving properly is bad for business as they can just drive away potential customers. It's like with any business: if someone is being unruly and refuses to stop then they get removed from the business.

> Hopefully someone comes along and straightens out this mess that was created.

If you have any ideas of how to reform and/or punish people who continuously act up via chat and/or gameplay while not punishing the innocent ones as well then we'd love to hear it.
